arts.ttl: ‘So tell me what you want…’ Spice Girl and F1 boss see Coventry City race into play-off contention
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. Coventry City were on song when two high profile special guests were at the CBS Arena to see a 2-1 victory over Watford that helped push them to within touching distance of the Championship play-off place.

arts.ttl: What Frank Lampard could 'sense in the stadium' as Coventry City secure third league win on the spin
arts.sum: Frank Lampard felt the fans “sensed” the moment Victor Torp secured Coventry City’s third Championship victory in the space of eight days with a brilliantly struck free-kick. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.
How the game at the Coventry Building Society unfolded as the Hornets are sunk by two Victor Torp goals.

arts.ttl: Torp double steers Lampard's Coventry past Watford
arts.sum: Victor Torp's brace earned Coventry their third successive win with a 2-1 victory over Watford at the CBS Arena.

arts.ttl: Victor Torp brace fires Coventry to victory over Watford
arts.sum: Watford scored through a Liam Kitching own goal.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings as Victor Torp tops perfect week for Frank Lampard's men - Andy Turner
arts.sum: There was a frantic end to the game when Watford pulled one back in the 82nd minute when sub Sissoko drilled a shot at goal and Liam Kitching got a touch to send it past Oliver Dovin – the City keeper making a good save at his near post minutes later to deny an equaliser. Torp gave the Sky Blues a deserved lead just after the half hour mark after the home side had dominated much of the game to that point, with Brandon Thomas-Asante enjoying two early chances on goal before Jack Rudoni sent in a cross from the right for the Danish midfielder to convert from six yards after a well timed run.

arts.ttl: One change as Frank Lampard names Coventry City team to face Watford
arts.sum: City: Oliver Dovin; Bobby Thomas, Joel Latibeaudiere, Liam Kitching; Milan van Ewijk, Jamie Allen, Victor Torp, Jake Bidwell; Jack Rudoni; Brandon Thomas-Asante, Ellis Simms. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: Coventry City v Watford live updates and team news from the CBS Arena
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. Get the latest Coventry City headlines sent straight to your phone

arts.ttl: Watford owner forced into humiliating Tom Cleverley U-turn after fan backlash
arts.sum: The future of Watford manager Tom Cleverley was bizarrely - but perhaps not unsurprisingly - thrust into the spotlight this week amid reports that former Villarreal boss Jose Martin Rojo was being lined up

arts.ttl: Coventry City transfer news as Fulham make 'interest known' for player 'not short of admirers'
arts.sum: The 24-year-old full-back has already been the subject of transfer speculation in the current window after Dutch outlet soccernews.nl claimed Turkish club Galatasaray were in talks with the Sky Blues about the player, while the former Netherlands Under-21 international was also linked with interest from Feyenoord and PSV in the summer. Fulham boss Marco Silva is “considering” making a move for Coventry City right-back Milan van Ewijk this month amid uncertain futures for two of his current defenders, it has been claimed.
